sentence.Network_en: Nonconformists retained a deep distrust of their Anglican neighbours.

sentence.Network_en: Anglicanism is the form of church life characteristic of the Anglican Communion.

sentence.Network_en: An Anglican diocesan court presided over by a bishop's chancellor or commissary.

entry.def: Anglican means belonging or relating to the Church of England, or to the churches related to it.
An Anglican is a Christian who is a member of the Church of England, or of one of the churches related to it.

example.ex: Both my parents were devout Anglicans.
example.tran: 我的父母都是虔诚的圣公会教徒。

means.word_mean: 1. a Protestant who is a follower of Anglicanism
1. of or pertaining to or characteristic of the Anglican church;
